story:
Once upon a time, in the beautiful country of South Africa, there was a little girl named Thandi. Thandi was a kind-hearted and adventurous girl who loved exploring the world around her. She lived in a cozy house near the edge of a lush, green forest, where she would spend hours playing and discovering new things.

One day, as Thandi was wandering through the forest, she stumbled upon a tiny, injured bird. Its wing was hurt, and it couldn't fly. Thandi knew she had to help the bird, so she gently picked it up and carried it back to her house.

Thandi's mother, who was a skilled healer, helped Thandi care for the bird. They made a small nest for it in a shoe box, and every day, Thandi would feed it and keep it company while it healed. As the days went by, the bird began to get stronger and its wing started to heal. Thandi was delighted to see the bird hopping around and flapping its wings, getting ready to fly again.

One sunny afternoon, Thandi took the bird outside to see if it was ready to fly. She held the bird in her hands and whispered, "It's time for you to go back to your home, little one. Fly high and be free." And with that, she gently tossed the bird into the air.

To Thandi's delight, the bird soared into the sky, its wings carrying it higher and higher. Thandi watched in awe as the bird circled above her, singing a beautiful song. She knew that the bird was grateful for her help, and she felt a sense of joy and fulfillment in her heart.

From that day on, Thandi knew that she had a special gift for helping animals. She continued to explore the forest, always on the lookout for creatures in need of her care. And every time she helped an animal, she felt the same sense of joy and fulfillment that she felt when she helped the bird.

And so, Thandi grew up to be a kind and compassionate person, always ready to lend a helping hand to those in need. And every night, as she lay in her bed, she would close her eyes and dream of the wonderful adventures that awaited her in the morning.

The end.

Goodnight my dear, I hope you have sweet dreams.
